intro: Biophytum albiflorum, commonly known as the whiteflower biophytum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, which is known for its adaptations to arid environments. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens.
